name: MTB Marathon - Season Prep - Moderate Volume - 3:1 - Strength
description:
#### MTB Marathon - Season Prep - Moderate Volume - 3:1 - Strength


The first step in your journey to getting faster!

​

If you are in need of any technical help or want to know more about the training terms used in this plan check out the [Wahoo SYSTM Help Center.](https://wahoosystm.com/HelpCenter)

​

Have a more specific question that isn't addressed in the Help Center? Head over to our [forum](https://wahoox.forum.wahoofitness.com/) to see if your question has been answered, or just post it for yourself.

​

For any questions on what to expect from your Strength Addon check out [these helpful articles](https://support.wahoofitness.com/hc/en-us/articles/4406401932050).

prospects.name: Cadence Builds
prospects.description:
One of the best sessions for neuromuscular training, this drill asks you to progressively build from a cadence of 90 RPM to your MAX over 30 seconds, recover, and repeat several times. Cadence builds improve how you recruit your leg, gluteal, and core muscles throughout your pedal stroke by progressing to your maximal cadence. By reaching your highest cadence possible, you are training the 'on/off' switch in each muscle group to not only work faster but to have less overlap with your other muscle groups. This session trains your hamstring muscles to 'turn off' when your quads 'turn on' and vice-versa, resulting in a more efficient pedal stroke at both high and low cadences.

​

**LEARN MORE**

Listen to The Knowledge podcast, by Wahoo Sports Science - The Benefits of High Cadence Training: [https://wahoosystm.com/BenefitsofHighCadence](https://wahoosystm.com/BenefitsofHighCadence)

prospects.name: Adventure For All 2023
prospects.description:
🎬 Film (2023): As one of Wahoo's close partners, Adventure For All's mission is to guide individuals with exceptionalities through life-changing adventures while creating innovative educational practices that ignite a shift in societal belief systems.Together we will guide individuals with exceptionalities through life-changing adventures while creating innovative educational practices that ignite a shift in societal belief systems.

​

**Experience the Adirondacks:**

Join four exceptional athletes in the Adirondack mountains on the adventure of a lifetime. These athletes challenge themselves, conquer fears, and demonstrate their ability to overcome obstacles, proving to themselves and the world they can achieve anything.

​

**Finish:**

Witness Riley, a remarkable young man with Autism and Tourette's, as he pedals beyond expectations to conquer the challenging 31+ mile Big Sugar gravel bike race. This isn't just a story about cycling; it's a journey of courage, hope, and the shattering barriers. With the unwavering support of his mom and the dedicated team at Adventure For All, Riley's adventure redefines what's possible, turning every pedal stroke into a victory for him and everyone who believed in his endless potential.

​

[**Find out more about Adventure For All**](https://adventureforall.org/)

​

🚴 Workout: This is a great way to watch a compelling documentary while developing your baseline aerobic fitness. The intensity of this workout will vary mostly between 60-70% of FTP, with heart rate remaining entirely in zone 2. This session will add minimal fatigue to your system, while still giving your aerobic engine the workload it needs to continue progressing.

prospects.name: Violator
prospects.description:
If your Neuromuscular Power (NM) and Anaerobic Capacity (AC) got together to throw a party and everybody left that party shattered but better off for it, then this would be it. _Violator_ is the perfect example of how the amount of recovery time between efforts dramatically changes the amount—and type—of training stress you get.

​

Yes, there are 64 sprints, but they're not all doing the same thing for your fitness. The first set of sprints has enough recovery that you'll be able to work your NM to the max. The second set still has enough recovery to allow you to hit high power numbers, but the reduced time between sprints stresses your ability to recover and repeat that high effort. That means you'll start to dip into AC. The last set—with equal sprint and recovery times—ensures your heart rate never gets a chance to drop down. That works your MAP like nobody's business.

prospects.name: French Pyrenees: Lac de Cap de Long
prospects.description:
Set in the heart of the Hautes-Pyrénées, this ride starts at Saint-Lary-Soulon and explores the sensational Route de Lac, finishing at the 2,160m summit of Lac de Cap de Long. The 22km climb is long, so we break it up into three sections for you. First, you'll have a nice long warm-up to ride into the village of Fabian. Once the proper climb starts, you'll ramp it up to a range between 70-90% threshold and hold it there. Toward the end, you'll start to work hard and finish off with an all-out assault on the summit. Along the way, you'll find out how the local wool is processed, how a network of ancient towers protected the region, why one house is covered in flowers, and what happened to all the local brown bears.

​

[**Route on Strava**](https://www.strava.com/activities/3778259865)

​

_Your Host: There are few people who know the mountains and roads of Europe better than Wahoo Ambassador Michael Cotty. As founder of The Col Collective, Mike has made a career out of riding, filming, and telling the story of epic rides and mountains across the continent. As your On Location co-creator and host, Mike's engaging character, curious mind, and friendly nature will have you cueing up your next ride with him before you've even finished the cool-down._

prospects.name: Trails: Cruising 1
prospects.description:
**What?**

A trail ride at a cruisy pace.

​

**Why?**

Variety is the spice of life and it’s also the best way to accomplish a few goals simultaneously. Focus on targeting your weaknesses during this trail session in order to improve them come race day.

​

**How?**

This is an unstructured ride - let the trail do the thinking today. If you find a section that you struggle to hit cleanly, repeat that section a few times until you feel comfortable with it. Don’t feel the need to practice every section you struggle with on a single ride, you can always come back another day! Keep the effort below 85% of FTP and spend the bulk of the ride around 60% of FTP.

​

Make sure to warm up well and cool down afterwards.
prospects.notes: This is an alternative to the planned indoor workout if you're able to ride outdoors.

prospects.name: The Other French Race
prospects.description:
🎬 Film: Rupert Guinness entered the Haute Route Alps in France looking for a new challenge to test his physical and mental strength. But after 800km of cycling through the Alps from Nice to Megève, the cycling journalist and author realized that the experience had delivered to him and the 400-plus starters something far greater. It had provided them with the adventure of a lifetime; from a sense of what it would be like to ride in the fabled Tour de France that he has reported on more than 30 times, to the creation of friendships with fellow riders forged by their shared suffering and encouragement for one another as they cycled through some of the toughest and most spectacular mountains that cycling has to offer.

​

🚴 Workout: This is a great way to watch a compelling documentary while developing your baseline aerobic fitness. The intensity of this workout will vary mostly between 60-70% of FTP, with heart rate remaining entirely in zone 2. This session will add minimal fatigue to your system, while still giving your aerobic engine the workload it needs to continue progressing.

prospects.name: 14 Vise Grips
prospects.description:
You can never have too many tools in the shed. After years of lobbying, we finally convinced Grunter von Agony to share his favorite set of implements with us: the fabled _14 Vise Grips_. Taken individually, each of the 14 intervals might appear tame, incapable of inflicting a significant squeeze. But when expertly applied in the correct order, they apply just the right kind of pressure to turn a Couchlandrian into a Sufferlandrian, just like turning coal into diamonds.

​

While the duration of each Vise Grip varies (from 30 seconds to 2 minutes), the power targets and recovery durations between them remain constant. The first 30-second interval should feel like a Sunday stroll in the park, but by the end of the first 2-minute Vise Grip, you'll be cursing Grunter's name. As the intervals get shorter, time will appear to stretch. That final 30-second effort will feel like an eternity. When you roll up to the second set, you'll know what you're in for, so just put your head down and prepare yourself to crush or be crushed.

​

Once you make it through all 14 Vise Grips, you will have been north of your Maximal Aerobic Power (MAP) for a total of 16 minutes. Changing the duration of the efforts (while keeping the same recovery) stresses your Anaerobic Capacity (AC) in a more dynamic way than, say, a more straightforward on/off session like _Half is Easy_. Since the longer efforts have the same recovery duration as the shorter ones, you will eventually deplete your AC, forcing your body to rely on your MAP to hit the required power targets. As the intervals get shorter in the second half of each set, you'll find that you have just enough left in the tank to complete the next effort.

​

Ultimately this workout combines the advantages of shorter, higher-power intervals with longer recovery (great for building muscular strength) with the advantages of longer, higher-power intervals with inadequate recovery (great for driving up your MAP and improving your AC).

prospects.name: Found in America
prospects.description:
🎬 Film (2020): After finishing the Race Across America on the podium, Dave Haase is coming back to win it. But is that what he's really looking for? Is there more to why he's taking on such a formidable challenge than the pursuit of victory alone? This is an honest look at the demands of a legendary ultra-endurance race and what one finds out on the road.

​

🚴 Workout: This is a great way to watch a compelling documentary while developing your baseline aerobic fitness. The intensity of this workout will vary mostly between 60-70% of FTP, with heart rate remaining entirely in zone 2. This session will add minimal fatigue to your system, while still giving your aerobic engine the workload it needs to continue progressing.

​

[Here's how to turn off on-screen graphics for the best viewing experience.](https://wahoosystm.com/HelpCenterInspiration)

prospects.name: To Get To The Other Side
prospects.description:
While you might think the only way to improve your FTP is to ride at, or above, your existing FTP, that isn't always the case. Your body can only handle so much time above FTP in any given week (or month, for that matter). But that doesn’t mean you should sit around doing nothing the rest of the time.

​

Your body is most efficient at clearing out lactate and other metabolic byproducts at 80-95% of FTP. This is one of the few sessions where you can consistently sit at that intensity and let your body churn away at this nice, efficient effort level. It's the ideal workout to end a hard, three-day block or add in during a rest week. It will give your body a little training stimulus while still allowing it to recover from whatever tortures you've recently put it through.

prospects.name: The Laps Tasmania
prospects.description:
🎬 Film (2019): Following Dustin Hollick and Rhian Slapp, two ordinary fathers with the survival skills of well-trained house pets, on a two-week journey around Tasmania with not much more than the clothes on their backs. No cash, no car, and no technology on an island at the bottom of the world.

​

prospects.name: The Tool Shed (Mash-Up)
prospects.description:
Because you're not the sharpest tool in the shed...

Simply put, this is a session for those looking to see how deep they can truly dig, or for those who think they might need to update their 4DP metrics (If you finish this session with minimal swearing and without stopping, it's time to re-test).

You might be looking at the profile and say to yourself, "Only doing the 2nd set from _The Shovel_ sounds like cheating. You would be right. That's why we would never do something as crazy as letting you start the 2nd set from The Shovel fresh. Instead, you get to be the Nail for the first 3 efforts from Nine Hammers. Once you've done that and wrapped up that second set from The Shovel, all that stands between you and that massive pit of exhaustion and GLORY are 2 more Hammers. Did we mention they were Hammers 8 and 9? No? Good, good. Forget we said anything. Just pretend you have 3 Hammers and 1 Shovel to contend with. Those last 2 Hammers are "Future You's" problem - let that chump deal with the nightmare.

​

When asking, "will this make me faster?" the answer is YES (and, at least in the short term, quite miserable). _The Shovel_ packs a massive Anaerobic Capacity (AC) punch, with inverse-micro intervals that dish out ever higher the power the shorter the interval. While_ Nine Hammers_ packs a huge MAP/FTP punch, it also helps drive up your sustained power regardless of your rider type or weakness. Facing the first 3 hammers gives your aerobic (MAP/FTP) system a hefty load to deal with and will just about fully deplete your AC stores, which makes this the perfect time to start the 2nd set from _The Shovel_. With depleted reserves, starting with the short 5 second sprints ensures that you are just fresh enough to push your NM system but fatigued enough that your AC never fully recovers for the duration of these intervals. With your AC depleted, heart rate pegged, and breathing rate through the roof, the last thing you WANT is the final 2 hammers. This isn't about what you want, though. It's about what you need.

​

By the time you start this set of hammers, your top-end power will be feeling completely drained; any "snap" you might usually rely on to make it through these 3-4 minute efforts will be long gone. That means you are facing down the final 2 hammers relying solely on your MAP and FTP. The higher your FTP, the faster you will recover, and the higher your MAP, the greater the punishment you can handle. Once you pick yourself up off the floor from hammers 8 and 9, you will have pushed your body to its absolute limits across almost every 4DP Metric, which will send you down the path to be a faster and more badass Sufferlandrian.

prospects.name: Wahoo Frontiers 2023
prospects.description:
🎬 Film (2023): Discover the incredible stories behind some of this year's top Wahooligan athletes:

**Chelsea Sodaro** is the reigning IRONMAN World Champion, but beyond her athletic prowess, Chelsea's greatest source of pride is her ability to show up for herself and her daughter. Chelsea shares the power of finding her voice, advocating for female athletes, and why motherhood is her most significant victory to date. Follow Chelsea's journey to defending her World Champion title in 2023.

​

**Heather Jackson:** As one chapter closes, a new one opens. After 15 years as a professional triathlete, Heather Jackson decided to challenge herself in new ways, build a fresh community, and push her own and other's expectations of what is humanly possible. In June, Heather tackled the Unbound Gravel 200, often hailed as the "Super Bowl" of gravel bike racing, and the iconic Western States Endurance Run, the world’s oldest 100-mile trail race. Facing these demanding events with just a two-week gap between them, the question looms: how will Heather approach her most ambitious goal yet?

​

🚴 Workout: This is a great way to watch a compelling documentary while developing your baseline aerobic fitness. The intensity of this workout will vary mostly between 60-70% of FTP, with heart rate remaining entirely in zone 2. This session will add minimal fatigue to your system, while still giving your aerobic engine the workload it needs to continue progressing.

prospects.name: French Pyrenees: Cirque de Gavarnie
prospects.description:
This ride finds you in the French Pyrenees to ride the gently climbing valley road up to the world-famous Cirque de Gavarnie. Starting in Luz-Saint-Sauveur, you'll work your way up the road with a series of low cadence strength work, some threshold work, and then a series of over/under efforts. As you ride, Mike will show you around the Bridge of Napolean III, the famous regional spit cakes, a river full of grain mills, and maybe even a bottle or two of the local craft beer.

​

[**Route on Strava**](https://www.strava.com/activities/3831540078)

​

_Your Host: There are few people who know the mountains and roads of Europe better than Wahoo Ambassador Michael Cotty. As founder of The Col Collective, Mike has made a career out of riding, filming, and telling the story of epic rides and mountains across the continent. As your On Location co-creator and host, Mike's engaging character, curious mind, and friendly nature will have you cueing up your next ride with him before you've even finished the cool-down._

prospects.name: Med. Coast: Massif de l'Esterel
prospects.description:
This 34-kilometer ride is split into two distinct parts. As we depart the village of Mandelieu-la-Napoule and hug the Mediterranean coastline, we’ll kick things off with a series of cadence pyramids. Although these in an of themselves may not feel overly taxing, as we head inland the fun really starts as Mike guides you through a series of threshold efforts with bursts on the striking red roads of l’Estérel, all the way to the summit of the Col Notre Dame. As we delve deeper into the many highlights of the area—from the historic villages that line the coast to the ritz and glitz of Cannes—we’re definitely going to be working up a sweat here. Luckily, we'll be finishing up with a visit to the famous Galimard perfumery. So take a deep breath and get ready to come out of this workout smelling like a rose.

​

[**Route on Strava**](https://www.strava.com/activities/4034551251)

prospects.name: From the Ground Up - Season 3 Pt 4
prospects.description:
🎬 Film (2023):

**Episode 6: Hours : Minutes : Seconds**

The final episode of Season 3, five separate stories that you have watched grow over the last 5 months, culminating in Leadville for the race. What is often missed in this project is that we truly believe in building a team, a family and more, that it would be even tougher to do alone. Sit down on your couch with some popcorn and a blanket, but don't forget to bring your friends - this one is full of moments that will make you want to get off the couch!

​

🚴 Workout: the workout accompanying this film varies from endurance to tempo to sub-threshold. The higher intensity efforts aren't the hardest you'll experience so that you can keep your attention on the film, however, they are just hard enough to help improve your FTP, oxygen utilization efficiency, and the ability to recover quickly between hard efforts. The workout intensity reflects the intensity of the riders in many places, so you may feel as if you're climbing Mont Ventoux or that you're a part of a sprint lead-out train on the run into the finish line.

​

[Here's how to turn off on-screen graphics for the best viewing experience.](https://wahoosystm.com/HelpCenterInspiration)

prospects.name: Fursa
prospects.description:
🎬 Film (2021): Fursa is the Swahili word for opportunity. Together with Amani Racing, we are supporting athletes from East Africa with the opportunity to race against the top gravel riders in the World. Four elite cyclists have been chosen to come to the US and race SBT GRVL, BWR Asheville & Vermont Overland developing new pathways for athletes from East Africa to show their full potential.

​

🚴 Workout: The workout accompanying this film is a recovery session. Intensity is low, with power remaining at or below 50% of FTP (2.5 on a scale from 1 to 10) with heart rate targets entirely in Zone 1. The intensity and cadence targets will vary throughout this session to keep it interesting, but not so much that it distracts you from the story.

​

[Here's how to turn off on-screen graphics for the best viewing experience.](https://wahoosystm.com/HelpCenterInspiration)

prospects.name: The Amazing Chase
prospects.description:
🎬 Film (2021): Ultra-endurance cyclist Jack Thompson set out to ride the 2021 Tour de France route as fast as he could. 3,552km divided over 21 stages, his goal was to chase down the PRO peloton on his way to Paris. What would it take? What was realistic? What was possible? Follow Jack's journey as he battles the elements, the vagaries of the route, and intense mental and physical fatigue to arrive at the Champs-Élysées in Paris.

​

🚴 Workout: The workout accompanying this film is a recovery session, which is a very low-intensity ride. It's so easy that your power remains at or below 50% of FTP or an RPE less than 2.5, and your heart rate stays in zone 1 the entire time. The intensity and cadence targets will vary throughout this session to keep it interesting (But not so interesting that you can't pay attention to the film).

prospects.name: # Getting Away With It (November Groundwork Challenge)
prospects.description:
This workout is part of the Wahoo X Monthly Challenge. Click [++here++](https://wahoox.forum.wahoofitness.com/t/wahoo-november-challenge-groundwork/30430) to find out more.

​

Wouldn't it be great if you could leave work to go for a ride? Even for an hour? Well, now's your chance. _Getting Away With It_ gets you out of the office and onto the roads of the French Pyrenees with your guide Michael Cotty of The Col Collective.

​

This is a great session to add toward the end of a training block. The shorter duration, sub-threshold efforts are fantastic for getting some extra FTP building while you are in a fatigued state. Extra emphasis on cadence stresses your nervous system, making your body more efficient at higher and lower RPMs while improving your form. The Neuromuscular training you get from this session is fantastic, so while your power never exceeds threshold, your body will learn to bring more energy to the pedals at all intensities.

prospects.name: From the Ground Up - Season 3 Pt 3
prospects.description:
🎬 Film (2023):

**Episode 4: Finding Balance**

We follow Megan Mouser and her journey from 3 years of FTGU. Megan is an incredible mom, self described as "Workin' on body positivity 1 mile at a time and the epitome of our community at From the Ground Up. We are so excited to finally share her story up to race day!

​

**Episode 5: Rookies Again**

What does it take for ex-NFL athletes to redefine a healthy lifestyle and take on something as foreign as riding a mountain

bike? Kawika and Amani took a leap this year, and are working to inspire and motivate other athletes post career. In this episode we look at Kawika and Amani's backgrounds and watch them learn to ride a MTB comfortably as they step onto a whole new type of playing field.

​

🚴 Workout: This is a great way to watch a compelling documentary while developing your baseline aerobic fitness. The intensity of this workout will vary mostly between 60-70% of FTP, with heart rate remaining entirely in zone 2. This session will add minimal fatigue to your system, while still giving your aerobic engine the workload it needs to continue progressing.

prospects.name: Tour of Norway 2
prospects.description:
**Featured rider:** Carl Fredrick HAGEN of Norway

**Event: **Tour of Norway

**Mission - "Wonderkid":** Experience the thrill of the breakaway with the peloton breathing down your neck - You're riding for Team Lotto Soudal - You've been in the breakaway all day. There's just one hour of racing left and you're sitting at the top of the virtual GC on the last day of the Tour of Norway, your home tour — Of any day to go all out and empty the tank, today is the day — Take your pulls, lead the breakaway and fight to stay away from the peloton.

​

**About ProRides**

Here’s your chance to experience what it’s like to ride in the biggest races in the world, thanks to SYSTM’s 4DP platform. We’ve taken the first-person camera footage and power data from a pro cyclist and analyzed it to determine which part of their 4DP® profile each of their efforts corresponds to. But since few of us can put down pro-level watts, we made it so all of the efforts are scaled to your own personal 4DP® profile. That means you get to experience exactly what the pros experience relative to your own abilities. When they sprint, you sprint. When they attack, you attack. When they sit up, you get to take it (relatively) easy. It's the most immersive, realistic race simulation out there.

​

[Here's some more information on how to create the most immersive ProRides experience.](https://wahoosystm.com/HelpCenterProRides)

​

**Featured Footage: **Velon

prospects.name: Serbia Upside Down Ep. 4
prospects.description:
🎬 Film: Serbia. A small country in the Balkan Peninsula that hides some of the most beautiful natural wonders and unique cultural heritage in this part of the world. Yet it remains unknown to many. Only the alternative, curious and brave plan their journeys in this hidden gem. However, a small self-organized crew from Serbia and Germany set a mission to discover and reveal those stunning natural creations of Serbia. On a bicycle. In just five days, they traversed 450 kilometers across six mountains of Western Serbia, and climbed around 11,000 meters to film and produce what you are about to experience.

​

🚴 Workout: This is a great way to watch a compelling documentary while developing your baseline aerobic fitness. The intensity of this workout will vary mostly between 60-70% of FTP, with heart rate remaining entirely in zone 2. This session will add minimal fatigue to your system, while still giving your aerobic engine the workload it needs to continue progressing.

prospects.name: Provence: Alpilles
prospects.description:
Set in a gorgeous area of Provence, France, the Alpilles is a hilly area nestled beneath the shadow of Mt. Ventoux. This 33k ride takes you through olive groves, vineyards, and ancient Roman ruins as you bang out a structured workout based on two sets of over/unders and a final round of big sprints. Woven in there are a few high-cadence drills to really get those neuromuscular signals humming.

​

Along the way, Mike will explain how the Alpilles mountains were formed, you'll visit one of Vincent Van Gough's favorite retreats, find out why windmills never took off in such a windy region, and pop into a local olive oil maker to taste test some of their best.

​

[**Route on Strava**](https://www.strava.com/activities/3924836189)

​

_Your Host: There are few people who know the mountains and roads of Europe better than Wahoo Ambassador Michael Cotty. As founder of The Col Collective, Mike has made a career out of riding, filming, and telling the story of epic rides and mountains across the continent. As your On Location co-creator and host, Mike's engaging character, curious mind, and friendly nature will have you cueing up your next ride with him before you've even finished the cool-down._

prospects.name: Micro Intervals/Tempo: 2 x 12 Plus 1 x 20
prospects.description:
These two mini Pyramids of Power might remind you of The Shovel... This one, however is a little less focused on Anaerobic Capacity and a little more on muscle endurance, due to that big blue block in the middle. The first pyramid will begin to fatigue your muscles and tax your AC before you face 20 minutes at tempo. With both of those efforts under your belt, the second pyramid will drain the rest of your AC and ask your aerobic system to pick up the slack. This might even feel similar to a mountain bike or cyclocross race effort- you take it out hard, jockeying for the hole shot or a front pack position before getting into the technical elements. Then you settle into a sustainable effort for a short while, maybe working with a couple others before battling it out for your final finishing position.

prospects.name: Trails: Cruising 1.5
prospects.description:
**What?**

A trail ride at a cruisy pace.

​

**Why?**

Variety is the spice of life and it’s also the best way to accomplish a few goals simultaneously. Focus on targeting your weaknesses during this trail session in order to improve them come race day.

​

**How?**

This is an unstructured ride - let the trail do the thinking today. If you find a section that you struggle to hit cleanly, repeat that section a few times until you feel comfortable with it. Don’t feel the need to practice every section you struggle with on a single ride, you can always come back another day! Keep the effort below 85% of FTP at all times and spend the bulk of the ride around 60% of FTP.

​

Make sure to warm up well and cool down afterwards.
prospects.notes: This is an alternative to the planned indoor workout if you're able to ride outdoors.

prospects.name: The Soul of a Cyclist
prospects.description:
🎬 Film: Directed by Nuno Tavares, The Soul of a Cyclist revolves around the subject of classic bicycles**. **Shot in Portugal and in England, the film captures personal experiences of individuals who own and ride classic bicycles and their deep connection with them. A film full of curiosity, joy and adventure.

​

🚴 Workout: This is a great way to watch a compelling documentary while developing your baseline aerobic fitness. The intensity of this workout will vary mostly between 60-70% of FTP, with heart rate remaining entirely in zone 2. This session will add minimal fatigue to your system, while still giving your aerobic engine the workload it needs to continue progressing.

prospects.name: Ruta Chingaza
prospects.description:
🎬 Film (2020): In February, legendary ultra-endurance cyclist Lael Wilcox, Joe Cruz, and filmmaker Rugile Kaladyte traveled to the Colombian capital, in partnership with Conservation International, Wahoo, and Bikepacking.com to launch the Bikepacking for Conservation Program. The project was designed to explore and scout a bikepacking route that would connect the bustling metropolis of Bogota, Colombia with rural communities and the Chingaza National Park. The resulting route — Ruta Chingaza — will help cyclists connect to nature and better understand the ecosystems upon which life and livelihoods in this area depend.

​

🚴 Workout: The workout accompanying this film is a recovery session. Intensity is low, with power remaining at or below 50% of FTP (2.5 on a scale from 1 to 10) with heart rate targets entirely in Zone 1. The intensity and cadence targets will vary throughout this session to keep it interesting, but not so much that it distracts you from the story.

​

[Here's how to turn off on-screen graphics for the best viewing experience.](https://wahoosystm.com/HelpCenterInspiration)

prospects.name: Galicia: Camarinas to Muxia
prospects.description:
It’s time for a wild coastal adventure with your host, Michael Cotty, across some of the stunning undulating roads of Galica, Spain. You’ll start at a historic lighthouse on the ‘Coast of Death’ before working your way deep into the rugged landscape that defines this region. The road will guide your workout, with big efforts up every hill and a chance to take it a bit easier on the descents. It’s not all hard work, though, Mike takes the time to show you around the fishing marina, where to find the ‘hunger herb’ and some of the sights around our finishing village, Muxia.

​

This is a great session for anyone who wants to get in a bit of sprint/anaerobic capacity efforts while laying down some solid aerobic time.

​

[**Route on Strava**](https://www.strava.com/activities/7392408454)

​

_Your Host: There are few people who know the mountains and roads of Europe better than Wahoo Ambassador Michael Cotty. As founder of The Col Collective, Mike has made a career out of riding, filming, and telling the story of epic rides and mountains across the continent. As your On Location co-creator and host, Mike's engaging character, curious mind, and friendly nature will have you cueing up your next ride with him before you've even finished the cool-down._

prospects.name: Chasing the Sun
prospects.description:
🎬 Film (2023): Fresh from a sold-out tour of UK cinemas, Chasing The Sun is the new documentary film from 2x BAFTA-winning director Michael B.Clifford. It explores extraordinary personal stories of ordinary cyclists taking on iconic endurance event Chase The Sun, revealing the power of the humble bicycle to transform lives and help save the planet.

The film features contributions from broadcaster and ITV’s voice of the Tour de France Ned Boulting, author and blogger Jools Walker, Turner Prize-winning artist Sir Richard Long and 4x Mountain Bike World Champion Tracy Moseley.

​

🚴 Workout: the workout accompanying this film varies from endurance to tempo to sub-threshold. The higher intensity efforts aren't the hardest you'll experience so that you can keep your attention on the film, however, they are just hard enough to help improve your FTP, oxygen utilization efficiency, and the ability to recover quickly between hard efforts. The workout intensity reflects the intensity of the riders in many places, so you may feel as if you're climbing Mont Ventoux or that you're a part of Cav's lead-out train on the run into the finish line.

​

[Here's how to turn off on-screen graphics for the best viewing experience.](https://wahoosystm.com/HelpCenterInspiration)

prospects.name: Sub-Threshold With Surges: 4 x 8
prospects.description:
While some of you will know this intensity level as "Sweet-Spot", we prefer the name Sub-Threshold, because we want to drive home the fact that you should keep your power below FTP. In the same way that longer Tempo efforts can feel "easy," these shorter Sub-Threshold efforts can also feel "easy". After all, if you can hold 100% of FTP for about an hour, then holding less than that for 8 minutes should be a piece of cake right? We know you can go harder for this short amount of time, but that is not what we are asking for.

​

This session is not intended to push you to your limits, nor is it designed to be a massive training load. The real purpose is to essentially keep your fatigue levels right where they are, by giving your body just enough intensity to ensure that you are not "more recovered" after today.

​

While some folks will say that there is no training benefit to such short Sub-Threshold efforts, when viewed in a bigger picture sense (like a 3-week training block) they can be the perfect efforts to ensure you get the most out of a longer training block.

​

We would even ask that you view this session as more of an assessment, rather than strictly a workout. That's because you should be comparing this power output to heart rate response and your own internal RPE. When you have heavy fatigue, your heart rate will struggle to hit its normal peaks. When fresh you would be getting into Z4 heart rate by the end of the last two intervals, and your RPE should never really climb above a 7. When holding onto excess fatigue, your heart rate won't climb above Z3, and your RPE will be above an 8. At the same time, if you have gained a significant amount of fitness, your Heart Rate will stay in Z3, and your RPE won't climb above 6. The secondary tell between improved fitness and fatigue is how quickly your heart rate drops after each effort. When fatigued, your heart rate won't drop below Z2 during the recovery.

​

While it is easy to rely solely on Power, you should always refer back to RPE and Heart Rate, and today is the perfect session to practice comparing the 3.

​

​

**Warm-Up**

20 minutes @ RPE 2 -- 45% of FTP -- HR <70%

1 minutes @ RPE 3 -- 55% of FTP -- HR <75%

1 minute @ RPE 4 -- 65% of FTP -- HR <80%

1 minute @ RPE 5 -- 75% of FTP -- HR <85%

1 minute @ RPE 6 -- 85% of FTP -- HR <90%

30 seconds @ RPE 7 -- 95% of FTP -- HR <95%

30 seconds @ RPE 9 -- 90-95% of AC (130-180% of FTP)

5 minutes @ RPE 2 -- 45% of FTP -- HR <75%

​

**Main Effort**

Number of Sets: 4

Rest Between Sets: 10 minutes @ RPE 2 -- 45% of FTP -- HR <75%

Interval Repeats per Set: 4

**Interval**

Surge: 30 sec @ RPE 8.5 -- 90% of MAP (105-130% of FTP)

Steady: 1 minutes 30 seconds @ RPE 7 -- 90% of FTP -- HR <100%

​

**Extra Volume**

13 minutes @ RPE 3 -- 60% of FTP -- HR <85%

​

**Cool Down**

5 minutes @ RPE 1.5 -- <45% of FTP -- HR <70%

🚴 Workout: This is a great way to watch a compelling documentary while developing your baseline aerobic fitness. prospects.name: AC: 6 x 45s
prospects.description:
There's no getting around the fact that this is a profoundly unpleasant session that will leave your legs feeling like jelly. This session is similar to The Trick, with a few differences. On the plus side, all of the efforts are 15-seconds shorter than those in The Trick. To make up for this, we added two more intervals to this session, bringing the total to 6. That means by the end of this session you will have plowed through 4.5-minutes of AC work.

This workout is one of the few sessions that we do NOT recommend you complete in ERG mode if you are on a smart trainer. The goal is to hold onto the highest power you can for the full 45-seconds. Inevitably in the later sets, your power will dip before you reach the end of the interval. What we want is for you to complete every effort having given everything for 45-seconds. We don't want ERG mode grinding you to a halt because you cannot maintain the (ridiculously) high power targets. Even if you drop down below FTP in the final 10-seconds of these efforts, as long as you are going flat out, you are doing it correctly.

Just take this session one interval at a time, and focus on giving your all for this one effort. You can worry about the others when you get to them. If you finish this session without swearing, then you didn't go hard enough!

​

**Warm Up**

1 minute 30 seconds @ RPE -- 50% of FTP -- HR <70

1 minute 15 seconds @ RPE 2.5 -- 55% of FTP -- HR <70

1 minute @ RPE 3.5 -- 65% of FTP -- HR <70

30 seconds @ RPE 2 -- 50% of FTP -- HR <70

30 seconds @ RPE 4.5 -- 75% of FTP -- HR <70

30 seconds @ RPE 3 -- 60% of FTP -- HR <70

30 seconds @ RPE 6.5 -- 90% of FTP -- HR <70

30 seconds @ RPE 4 -- 70% of FTP -- HR <70

45 seconds @ RPE 7.5 -- 100% of FTP -- HR <90

30 seconds @ RPE 2 -- 50% of FTP -- HR <70

15 seconds @ RPE 9 -- 120% of FTP -- HR >105

45 seconds @ RPE 2 -- 50% of FTP -- HR <70

15 seconds @ RPE 10 -- 200% of FTP -- HR >105

1 minute 30 seconds @ RPE 2 -- 50% of FTP -- HR <70

​

**Main Effort**

Number of Sets: 6

Rest Between Sets: 5 minutes 15 seconds @ RPE 2 -- 50% of FTP -- HR <70

Interval Repeats Per Set: N/A

**Interval**

Effort: 45 seconds @ RPE 9.5 -- 150% of FTP -- HR >105

​

**Extra Volume**

N/A

​

**Cool Down**

4 minutes @ RPE 1.5 -- 45% of FTP -- HR <70

prospects.name: Cadence Drills (Builds/Holds/Single Leg)
prospects.description:
This workout combines several technique driven intervals. These will improve your overall form and efficiency on the bike. The first two drills, Cadence Holds and Builds, are designed to improve the way you recruit your leg, glute and core muscles throughout your pedal stroke. They do this by forcing you to sustain a cadence just above 'comfortable' and by pushing you to your maximal cadence.

​

The last drill, Single Leg Efforts, ask you to unclip one leg and ride at a steady, single-legged effort. This forces you to pull up on the pedal instead of just pushing down and ensures maximal muscle awareness and engagement. This workout is best done while riding indoors on a trainer because even small variations in terrain can affect your ability to properly execute this workout. The majority of this workout is done in heart rate Z1/2 /// 50-75% of threshold /// RPE 2-5. You should keep the effort level below threshold (heart rate Z4, 100% of threshold, RPE 7-8) during the max cadence efforts.

​

WORKOUT GOALS:

- To improve stillness and stability at high cadences.
- To improve muscle fiber engagement for improved efficiency at all cadences.
- To increase maximum cadence.
- To make that pedal stroke as smooth as butter.

CADENCE TARGETS:

- Warm-up 80-90rpm
- Build: 90-150rpm
- Hold: 115rpm
- Single Leg: 85rpm

Listen to The Knowledge podcast, by Wahoo Sports Science - The Benefits of High Cadence Training: [https://wahoosystm.com/BenefitsofHighCadence](https://wahoosystm.com/BenefitsofHighCadence)

​

**Warm Up**

7 minutes @ RPE 2.5 -- 50% of FTP -- HR <70%

1 minute @ RPE 3 -- 65% of FTP -- HR <70%

1 minute @ RPE 4 -- 75% of FTP -- HR <70%

3 minutes @ RPE 2.5 -- 50% of FTP -- HR <70%

​

**Main Effort**

Number of Sets: 3

Rest Between Sets: 8 minutes @ RPE 23 -- 55% of FTP -- HR <70%

Interval Repeats Per Set: N/A

**Interval**

Cadence Build: 30 seconds @ RPE 8 -- Starting at 90RPM Build to Max RPM -- Max Power is NOT Goal

Recovery: 1 minute @ RPE 2 -- 45% of FTP -- HR <70%

Cadence Hold: 45 seconds @ RPE 7.5 -- <100% FTP -- Highest RPM you can hold without Bouncing

Recovery: 1 minute @ RPE 2 -- 45% of FTP -- HR <70%

Single Leg: 1 minute @ RPE 6 -- Single Leg Only -- <50% of FTP

Recovery: 1 minute @ RPE 2 -- 45% of FTP -- HR <70%

Single Leg: 1 minute @ RPE 6 -- Single Leg Only, Opposite Leg -- <50% of FTP (100% of FTP with both legs = 50% of FTP

with one leg)

​

**Extra Volume**

N/A

​

**Cool Down**

8 minutes 15 seconds @ RPE 2.5 -- 50% of FTP -- HR <70%

prospects.name: Blender
prospects.description:
A smorgasbord of Suffering, this session has it all. Originally created in Coach Sir Neal Henderson's Penn State dorm room in 1992, it's his weapon of choice for bringing the pain (shakes).

​

What's in the Blender? First, a variety of longer efforts build sustained power while also making sure you're sufficiently fatigued. This initial beatdown is necessary to ensure you get the maximum benefit from _Blender_'s infamous 'Pain Shakes.' Three sets of these little devils help you develop a supernatural ability to recover from big efforts. The bonus is that you also beef up your ability to produce high-end power, building Anaerobic Capacity and Maximal Aerobic Power simultaneously.

​

The threshold efforts at the end are the bitter cherry on the sundae, improving your body's ability to produce aerobic power and helping make sure your FTP will get the same boost as your AC and MAP. A rising tide of lactic acid raises all boats. Oh, and clocking in at one hour and 40 minutes, Blender will also help whip your endurance into a frenzy.

prospects.name: Heart Flatline to Finish Line
prospects.description:
🎬 Film (2021): Heart Flatline to Finish Line is the raw and emotional journey of six cardiac patients from hospital beds to the finish line of one of the world's most grueling endurance events, the Ironman triathlon.

​

🚴Workout: This workout is a great way to watch a compelling documentary while developing your baseline aerobic fitness. The intensity will vary mostly between 60-70% of FTP; mostly endurance with a sprinkling of low tempo mixed in. This session will add minimal fatigue to your system while still giving your aerobic engine the workload it needs to continue progressing.

prospects.name: Full Circle
prospects.description:
🎬 Film (2021): From filmmaker / ultra-endurance cyclist Mike Cotty:

​

"For many of us, cycling serves as a means of self-exploration—bridging gaps between the past, present and future. The blend between mind and body, working together to overcome hard moments—be it physical, mental or emotional—and how we learn to cope in our own mind is essential in being able to process the past, be true to ourselves in the present, and create moments of inner peace in the future.

​

A decade after crossing the French Pyrénées non-stop on a ride that would act as a catalyst for change, I wanted to share this story for the first time. To give an insight into the deeper meaning behind some of the mountain challenges you may have seen me undertake over the years, I felt now was the time to head back to my mountains, return to source, and embrace the unknown.

​

Overcoming the mountains of our mind, from escapism to reconnection. 10 years, 10 cols and 10,000 meters of climbing. This is my story of going Full Circle.

​

Thank you for watching. I truly hope there is something in this video that can help you in your own journey.

​

Peace,

Mike Cotty"

​

🚴 Workout: The workout accompanying this film is a recovery session, which is a very low-intensity ride. It's so easy that your power remains at or below 50% of FTP or an RPE less than 2.5, and your heart rate stays in zone 1 the entire time. The intensity and cadence targets will vary throughout this session to keep it interesting (But not so interesting that you can't pay attention to the film).

prospects.name: From the Ground Up - Season 4 Pt 2
prospects.description:
🎬 Film (2024):

**Episode 4: Setting An Example**

In Episode 4 we arrive in Steamboat Springs, CO and start to settle in before race day. We pre ride the course, pick up packets and find some nerves. In our final athlete feature we dive into what drives Kristen Myers? How does the super mom do it all and still find time to train? This episodes is all about the final preparations before race day.

​

**Episode 5: Mind Over Matter**

In our last episode, we reach the culmination of all our riders hard work and arrive in Steamboat Springs, CO for the SBT GRVL race. Do they have what it takes to finish 125 miles with less than 6 months of training? Each person will battle their own self doubt as the gun goes off for the final time this season.

​

🚴 Workout: This is a great way to watch a compelling documentary while developing your baseline aerobic fitness. The intensity of this workout will vary mostly between 60-70% of FTP, with heart rate remaining entirely in zone 2. This session will add minimal fatigue to your system, while still giving your aerobic engine the workload it needs to continue progressing.

​

[Here's how to turn off on-screen graphics for the best viewing experience.](https://wahoosystm.com/HelpCenterInspiration)

prospects.name: Primers
prospects.description: Whether you have a 4DP® fitness test coming up, a group ride you want to smash, that event you have been training all winter for, or even just a fun route you want to have a great ride on, this is the perfect session to do the day before. Unlike other SYSTM sessions, this one should not be viewed as a stand-alone “training” session, but rather, the ace up your sleeve you pull out when that big ride comes around. The key to this session is having you spend just enough time right around threshold, with sufficient recovery between efforts and a handful of sprints to prime all of your systems for tomorrow's event.

prospects.name: Half Monty (Ramp Test)
prospects.description:
**Half Monty: The Easy One.**

​

We recommend this fitness test for:

- Newer riders
- Athletes with limited experience pacing maximal efforts / fitness testing.
- Those who are mid-plan or who just want to get a sense of where their fitness is.

The _Half Monty_ 4DP fitness test is the most accurate and complete ramp test available. While it's not as comprehensive or as accurate as our main fitness test, _Full Frontal_, it's far more approachable and easier to pace for new riders. It also doesn't require any special preparation. You just need to feel relatively fresh.

​

Based on more than a year of research (and after dozens of lab tests and thousands of online tests) and using sophisticated analysis of power and heart rate data, _Half Monty_ is far more accurate and comprehensive than standard ramp tests.

​

It also tells you more about who you are as an athlete. _Half Monty_ provides you with your FTP, Maximal Aerobic Power (MAP), and Cycling Threshold Heart Rate (cTHR), all of which we use to personalize your workout targets.

​

If you're still using the 4DP estimates when you set up your account, _Half Monty_ will also refine your AC and NM estimates (but will not do so if you've done _Full Frontal_ or manually adjusted your estimates). If you want fully accurate AC and NM, as well as your Rider Type, Strengths, Weaknesses, and training plans adjusted to those Strengths and Weaknesses, you'll need to expose yourself to the _Full Frontal_ 4DP fitness test.

​

Ready to climb the ramp? You'll need the following before you start:

- A heart rate monitor if you want the most accurate results. Don't have one? Order one [HERE](https://wahoofitness.com/devices)
- Some kind of power device connected (trainer, power meter, virtual power, etc.)
- Be ready to pay close attention to the instructions in the workout
- Be sure your profile is complete and up-to-date (Profile > About You). Accurate information helps us make our calculations

**LEARN MORE**

Listen to '[Why Fitness Testing Matters](https://the-knowledge-by-wahoo-sports-science.simplecast.com/episodes/testing-testing-1-2-3-why-fitness-testing-matters)' on The Knowledge Podcast by Wahoo Sports Science.

​

[Here's some more information on how to get the most from your fitness test.](https://wahoosystm.com/HelpCenterFitnessAssessment)

prospects.name: Across the Mountains
prospects.description:
🎬 Film (2020): _Across the Mountains_ follows legendary cyclist Michael Cotty through two different adventures. The first, _Les Alpes_, is the story of Mike's non-stop ride from Evian-Les-Bains to Nice across the heart of the Alps: a journey of 677km with 17 mountain passes and more than 16,000 meters of climbing. The second, _The Road to Mont Blanc_, sees Mike tackle a 1,000 km non-stop journey across 21 mountains in the Dolomites, Eastern and Swiss Alps before finishing at Mont Blanc. Featuring never-before-seen footage and exclusive commentary by Mike Cotty himself.

​

🚴 Workout: The workout accompanying this film is a recovery session. Intensity is low, with power remaining at or below 50% of FTP (2.5 on a scale from 1 to 10) with heart rate targets entirely in Zone 1. The intensity and cadence targets will vary throughout this session to keep it interesting, but not so much that it distracts you from the story.

​

[Here's how to turn off on-screen graphics for the best viewing experience.](https://wahoosystm.com/HelpCenterInspiration)

​

prospects.name: Provence: Luberon
prospects.description:
If those are the Luberon mountains, we must be in Provence, France. Starting in the village of Roussillon, today's ride takes you some stunning scenery -- if you're able to notice through the series of short(ish), but intense, intervals. To take your mind off the effort, Mike gives you a geology lesson, shows you how the local energy bars are made, tells a rather gruesome love story, walks you down some rather narrow village paths, and explains what a 'dog drowning boat' is.

​

[**Route on Strava**](https://www.strava.com/activities/3914666714)

​

_Your Host: There are few people who know the mountains and roads of Europe better than Wahoo Ambassador Michael Cotty. As founder of The Col Collective, Mike has made a career out of riding, filming, and telling the story of epic rides and mountains across the continent. As your On Location co-creator and host, Mike's engaging character, curious mind, and friendly nature will have you cueing up your next ride with him before you've even finished the cool-down._

prospects.name: Made This
prospects.description:
🎬 Film (2024): In professional bike racing, we don't often see the whole picture. We only see the starts and the finishes, the breakaways and crashes, the near misses and podiums. Made This presented by Wahoo + MAAP is a series of behind-the-scenes, unfiltered front-row access with women's pro cycling team Lifeplus - Wahoo:

1. **Sisterhood: **Dedication, challenges, commitment, belief, family and sisterhood are all components of what it takes to be a professional racing team. In the first of a series of behind-the-scenes, unfiltered front-row access with team Lifeplus-Wahoo, MADE THIS is a collection of short films from MAAP Pro Team Racing that reveals what it takes to make a champion a champion.
2. **Prepared for anything: **The excitement of Holy Week at the Tour de Flanders is upon us, and Team Lifeplus-Wahoo is gearing up for a challenging ride. With 163km to conquer, featuring 12 climbs and seven cobbled stretches, not to mention seven slippery flat stone sections—all under a deluge of rain—anything could happen.
3. **Passion on the cobbles: **Join us as we dive deep into the chaotic and exhilarating world of the Paris-Roubaix, one of cycling's most grueling races. Amidst the cobblestones and mud, Team Lifeplus-Wahoo faces the ultimate test of endurance and skill. With a new lineup and high stakes, the team navigates the unpredictable nature of this legendary race, where luck can play a huge role and every second counts.
4. **Home sweet home: **After a fallow year for the tour, the team are eager to push for results in front of an expectant crowd. But instead of the warm welcome on familiar roads, disaster strikes the first morning of the race. As national news of the unfortunate event breaks, the team are left wondering if they'll be able to compete or if this becomes a home visit to forget. What follows is a true act of human kindness and a gesture that symbolises the unifying bond of the women's pro peloton.

​

🚴 Workout: The workout accompanying this film is a recovery session. It's a very low-intensity ride, with your power remaining at or below 50% of FTP (an RPE less than 2.5 on a scale from 1 to 10) and your heart rate in Zone 1. The intensity and cadence targets will vary throughout this session to keep it interesting, but not so much that it distracts you from the story.

​

[Here's how to turn off on-screen graphics for the best viewing experience.](https://wahoosystm.com/HelpCenterInspiration)

prospects.name: London-Edinburgh-London
prospects.description:
🎬 Film (2016): London Edinburgh London follows a group of cyclists from around the world on a remarkable feat of endurance. Join their ride up the length of Britain - from London to Edinburgh and back again - in under five days. Traveling over 1400km, a continuous distance far further than most of them had ever ridden before, our unlikely and eccentric heroes are not only tested physically but face the mental challenge, "can I push myself further? Can I go one more day?".

​

🚴 Workout: This is a great way to watch a compelling documentary while developing your baseline aerobic fitness. The intensity of this workout will vary mostly between 60-70% of FTP, with heart rate remaining entirely in zone 2. This session will add minimal fatigue to your system, while still giving your aerobic engine the workload it needs to continue progressing.

prospects.name: Strade Bianche 1
prospects.description:
**Featured rider:** Tosh Van der Sande of Belgium

**Event:** Strade Bianche

**Mission - "The Scout":** Welcome to the famous white roads of Tuscany: dusty, unpredictable, and unbelievably hilly. You got in the early break to take the pressure off your teammates. By giving them a bit of a rest early on they'll have a better chance of making a move as the race winds towards the iconic finish in the picturesque hill town of Sienna. Your job is to make sure everybody in the break works well together to maintain a gap and hold off the peloton for as long as you can. The other teams' star riders are breathing down your neck. How long can you keep them at bay?

​

**About ProRides**

Here’s your chance to experience what it’s like to ride in the biggest races in the world, thanks to SYSTM’s 4DP platform. We’ve taken the first-person camera footage and power data from a pro cyclist and analyzed it to determine which part of their 4DP® profile each of their efforts corresponds to. But since few of us can put down pro-level watts, we made it so all of the efforts are scaled to your own personal 4DP® profile. That means you get to experience exactly what the pros experience relative to your own abilities. When they sprint, you sprint. When they attack, you attack. When they sit up, you get to take it (relatively) easy. It's the most immersive, realistic race simulation out there.

​

[Here's some more information on how to create the most immersive ProRides experience.](https://wahoosystm.com/HelpCenterProRides)

​

**Featured Footage: **Velon

prospects.name: De Stig
prospects.description:
🎬 Film (2020): De Stig is a 90-minute documentary film about life, but especially rehabilitation, by professional cyclist Stig Broeckx, who crashed heavily during the 2016 Tour of Belgium.

​

He was involved in a crash with two race motorcycles and nearly lost his life. The then-26-year-old Belgian was taken to hospital with serious head injuries, including a fractured skull and bleeding on the brain, and was in a coma for months. At the time doctors feared he may never regain consciousness.

​

Stig's story is a universal story of the bad luck of one young man and his endless perseverance and positivity to overcome. It’s a story of unconditional love from his family and friends. It’s a story of hope and even though many of us won’t face something as severe as Stig, we all struggle with life sometimes. There is a lesson in Stig’s contagious smile for all of us.

​

🚴 Workout: While we are all about the High-Intensity Interval Training that most of our videos dish out, riding to this Inspiration film is a great way to watch an interesting film while developing your baseline aerobic fitness. The intensity of this workout will vary mostly between 60-70% of FTP, with heart rate remaining entirely in zone 2. This session will add minimal fatigue to your system, while still giving your aerobic engine the workload it needs to continue progressing.

​

[Here's how to turn off on-screen graphics for the best viewing experience.](https://wahoosystm.com/HelpCenterInspiration)

prospects.name: Trails: Cruising 2
prospects.description:
**What?**

A trail ride at a cruisy pace.

​

**Why?**

Variety is the spice of life and it’s also the best way to accomplish a few goals simultaneously. Focus on targeting your weaknesses during this trail session in order to improve them come race day.

​

**How?**

This is an unstructured ride - let the trail do the thinking today. If you find a section that you struggle to hit cleanly, repeat that section a few times until you feel comfortable with it. Don’t feel the need to practice every section you struggle with on a single ride, you can always come back another day! Keep the effort below 85% of FTP at all times and spend the bulk of the ride around 60% of FTP.

​

Make sure to warm up well and cool down afterwards.
prospects.notes: This is an alternative to the planned indoor workout if you're able to ride outdoors.

prospects.name: Serbia Upside Down Ep. 1
prospects.description:
🎬 Film: Serbia. A small country in the Balkan Peninsula that hides some of the most beautiful natural wonders and unique cultural heritage in this part of the world. Yet it remains unknown to many. Only the alternative, curious and brave plan their journeys in this hidden gem. However, a small self-organized crew from Serbia and Germany set a mission to discover and reveal those stunning natural creations of Serbia. On a bicycle. In just five days, they traversed 450 kilometers across six mountains of Western Serbia, and climbed around 11,000 meters to film and produce what you are about to experience.

​

🚴 Workout: The workout accompanying this film is a recovery session. It's a very low-intensity ride, with your power remaining at or below 50% of FTP (an RPE less than 2.5 on a scale from 1 to 10) and your heart rate in Zone 1. The intensity and cadence targets will vary throughout this session to keep it interesting, but not so much that it distracts you from the story.

prospects.name: Hell Hath No Fury
prospects.description:
This takes one of the oldest FTP building workouts, the venerable 2 x 20, and makes it exciting. Forcing your body to churn out power right below, at, and just above threshold for 20-minute intervals dramatically improves your ability to generate sustainable power. It's great for building your FTP (unless you have an unusually low MAP...in which case you're going to find this session a bit challenging).

​

By itself, the 3-minute time trial effort at the end would not be much to deal with, but after churning out threshold power for 40 minutes, hitting this 3-minute effort at 100% will ensure you stress your MAP enough to give this session a slight edge over other FTP Builder workouts.

prospects.name: Tempo Alternating: 3 x 15
prospects.description:
If you're looking for a session that will challenge and help build your aerobic fitness, this is it! With three sets of 15 minutes at tempo effort (alternating between 85 and 75% of FTP in 2-3 minute intervals, you'll end up with 45 minutes of quality aerobic work. This is a great session to help increase your endurance and bridge the gap between shorter tempo efforts and longer ones like our 2 x 25, or a 60-75 minute tempo build. In addition, this session will help build your muscular endurance as well as cardiovascular endurance as the cadence targets are set in the 80-85 RPM range, stimulating the muscular demand slightly more than the cardiovascular aspect.

​

**Warm Up **

6 minutes @ RPE 3 -- 60% of FTP -- HR <70%

1 minute @ RPE 6.5 -- 90% of FTP -- HR <100%

4 minutes @ RPE 2 -- 50% of FTP -- HR <70%

​

**Main Effort **

Number of sets: 3

Rest between sets: 3 minutes @ RPE 3 -- 60% of FTP -- HR <70%

Interval repeats per: 3

**Interval **

Effort: 3 minutes @ RPE 6 -- 85% of FTP -- HR <100

Steady: 2 minutes @ RPE 4.5 -- 75% of FTP -- HR <90%

​

**Extra Volume **

N/A

​

**Cool Down **

5 minutes @ RPE 2 -- 50% of FTP -- HR <70%

prospects.name: It Seemed Like A Good Idea At The Time (ISLAGIATT)
prospects.description:
When you want to increase your endurance and add some threshold work but only have two hours, this is the session you need. By adding in multiple surges and short chunks of time above threshold, ISLAGIATT overloads your system with metabolic byproducts ('the nasties'), which your body has to learn to clear out more efficiently.

​

Combining such long interval durations with these hard surges not only forces your body to cope with the effort, but it pushes you harder mentally because after each surge, the effort right at threshold “feels” harder than it should. With the final intervals focusing more on short, repeated efforts, you'll stress your body's ability to recover when deeply fatigued, making this more than just an “endurance builder" workout, but one that will help you keep churning out power deep into the final kilometers of challenging rides or events.

prospects.name: The Last Rider
prospects.description:
🎬 Film (2022): The heroic true story of American cyclist Greg LeMond, considered to be one of the greatest cyclists of all time, who defied the odds for one of the most triumphant comeback stories in sporting history. The first, male American to win the Tour de France, LeMond came back from the brink of death to beat his famed rivals in the historic and nail-biting race at the 1989 Tour de France.

Directed by Alex Holmes and featuring exclusive interviews with LeMond and his wife Kathy as well as, never before seen footage, The Last Rider is an exhilarating portrait of one of the greatest athletes of our time.

​

🚴 Workout: the workout accompanying this film varies from endurance to tempo to sub-threshold. The higher intensity efforts aren't the hardest you'll experience so that you can keep your attention on the film, however, they are just hard enough to help improve your FTP, oxygen utilization efficiency, and the ability to recover quickly between hard efforts. The workout intensity reflects the intensity of the riders in many places, so you may feel as if you're climbing Mont Ventoux or that you're a part of Cav's lead-out train on the run into the finish line.

​

[Here's how to turn off on-screen graphics for the best viewing experience.](https://wahoosystm.com/HelpCenterInspiration)

prospects.description:
🎬 Film (2015): This is the story of Australian cycling legend Steve Fairless who at only twenty-six years old rode for Australia in the 1988 Seoul Olympics before giving up his sport to raise a family. Now at fifty, Steve’s finally ready to make a comeback, proving it’s never too late to chase your dreams.

🚴 Workout: This is a great way to watch a compelling documentary while developing your baseline aerobic fitness. The intensity of this workout will vary mostly between 60-70% of FTP, with heart rate remaining entirely in zone 2. This session will add minimal fatigue to your system, while still giving your aerobic engine the workload it needs to continue progressing.

prospects.name: Standing Starts
prospects.description:
_Standing Starts_ closely simulates a lifting session on the bike because it requires the engagement of your core, upper body, and lower body. It trains your ability to generate force through the pedals by ensuring you recruit ALL of your muscles to get those cranks turning. No matter your preferred discipline, these efforts are key to teaching your body to recruit all of the muscle fibers in your legs.

​

All of the benefits in this session come from hitting these 20-second efforts as hard as you possibly can. To do that, you need full recovery between each sprint, and you need to respect that recovery. These efforts should see you start at super low RPMs with very high torque. As you start and increase the effort, your cadence will naturally increase. **Your goal is to get your cadence as high as possible by the end of each 20-second effort.** To maximize your muscle recruitment, you want to both push down and pull up on the pedals at the start. Proper core engagement is a must - your legs need a good strong backboard to push against.

​

We understand that not everyone's trainer has the necessary resistance or the required stability to perform this workout as described. If you can't safely stand up, then you can get much of the same benefit by doing these efforts seated. If your trainer can’t handle the rapid change in speed or does not have high enough resistance at a super low cadence, then you can start the efforts at a higher cadence and treat them as “normal” all-out sprints.

prospects.name: N. Henderson 2: Rabbit Mountain
prospects.description:
It's your first day joining Neal for a ride, so he's taking you out with a few of his friends -- Jeff, Julie, and Heather -- for a series of four, 10-minute repeats on the infamous Rabbit Mountain. And while the road might repeat, the efforts won't as Neal's come up with a different approach for each one.

​

In between the efforts, you'll learn that Neal is a bit of a collector -- at least when it comes to cycling stuff. He shows you his personal bike collection (he really takes N+1 to the next level), lets you dig around in his wardrobe, and even takes you down to the wine cellar for a look at some pretty special bottles.

​

**When to ride: Do this on day 1 of the 7-day plan.**

​

_About: Neal Henderson is one of the most accomplished coaches in cycling and multi-sport. His athletes have won more than 50 World Championships, set numerous world and national records, captured Olympic medals, worn leaders jerseys, and won stages in races like the Tour de France. Neal, a former professional triathlete, has won numerous Coach of the Year awards throughout his career from organizations like the US Olympic Committee, USA Cycling and USA Triathlon. Watch the Introduction to this series to learn more._

prospects.name: Costa Blanca: Puerto de la Vall de Ebo (Recharger Ride)
prospects.description:
This is an active recovery ride built with purpose. Low-intensity endurance work is paired with brief high-cadence neuromuscular activations to keep the nervous system awake without creating new fatigue. You’ll stay well below threshold throughout, allowing your body to absorb previous hard sessions and prepare for what’s ahead.

​

Set on the peaceful roads leading to the summit of Port de la Vall d’Ebo, this ride promotes circulation, technique, and mental reset. It’s ideal after race days or big training blocks — a smart session that helps you recover better, so you can train harder tomorrow. No ego, no watts chasing — just intentional recovery done right.

​

[**Wahoo Route**](https://www.strava.com/activities/13996505846)

​

_Your Host: There are few people who know the mountains and roads of Europe better than Wahoo Ambassador Michael Cotty. As founder of The Col Collective, Mike has made a career out of riding, filming, and telling the story of epic rides and mountains across the continent. As your On Location co-creator and host, Mike's engaging character, curious mind, and friendly nature will have you cueing up your next ride with him before you've even finished the cool-down._

prospects.name: Tapers
prospects.description:
When it comes to "peaking", or performing at your absolute best on a given day, the key is nailing your Taper. The term "Taper" refers to how you train in the week or so before your target event to ensure you deliver your best performance. Generally, tapering means reducing your total training volume but continuing to hit some high-intensity efforts. While there are individual variations in the best way to taper, this session has been used by countless professionals leading into the biggest races of their lives -- athletes like World Champions Rohan Dennis and Flora Duffy.

​

With 3 sets of micro-intervals (40/20s, 30/30s, and 20/40s) you will hit your system with just enough intensity to keep your legs sharp and responsive, without adding any real fatigue. Outside of those 3 sets of micro-intervals, this session is purposefully short and easy. This is a preparation session, not a training session! After all, your event is just around the corner and all of the important training is behind you. Riding harder or longer today will do absolutely nothing to increase your fitness by event day; in fact, all that would do is increase your fatigue, which will only hurt your performance. Rather, this session makes sure your body is humming along and ready to perform on the big day.

prospects.name: Primers
prospects.description: Whether you have a 4DP® fitness test coming up, a group ride you want to smash, that event you have been training all winter for, or even just a fun route you want to have a great ride on, this is the perfect session to do the day before. Unlike other SYSTM sessions, this one should not be viewed as a stand-alone “training” session, but rather, the ace up your sleeve you pull out when that big ride comes around. The key to this session is having you spend just enough time right around threshold, with sufficient recovery between efforts and a handful of sprints to prime all of your systems for tomorrow's event.

prospects.name: Full Frontal (4DP Assessment)
prospects.description:
Full Frontal: The Complete One.

We recommend the Full Frontal 4DP fitness assessment for:

- Experienced riders.
- Athletes with experience pacing maximal efforts / fitness testing.
- Those about to start—or who have just finished—a training plan.

This is our full 4DP fitness test and is the only test that exposes every aspect of your unique physiology in a single hour. Developed by Head of Wahoo Sports Science Coach Neal Henderson, Full Frontal uses the same lab-verified testing protocol that Coach Neal has used at the highest level for over a decade with professional and amateur athletes.

​

This test will provide you with a complete Four-Dimensional Power profile, identify your Rider Type, and tell you exactly what aspects of your fitness you need to focus on to become a more complete cyclist. More importantly, SYSTM will then use your results to set personalized power targets for all of your workouts based on your unique profile, resulting in the most precise, effective workouts available. Your results will also be used to tailor all of your training plans.

​

We recommend re-testing with Full Frontal every 8-12 weeks or as prescribed by your training plan.

​

**LEARN MORE**

Listen to '[Why Fitness Testing Matters](https://the-knowledge-by-wahoo-sports-science.simplecast.com/episodes/testing-testing-1-2-3-why-fitness-testing-matters)' on The Knowledge Podcast by Wahoo Sports Science

​

[Here's some more information on how to get the most from your fitness test.](https://wahoosystm.com/HelpCenterFitnessAssessment)

prospects.name: 03. Establishing the Goal Setting Habit
prospects.description:
**GOAL SETTING**

A clear plan of action is essential to any undertaking. Setting concrete, actionable goals will keep you motivated and on track; whether you’re eyeing the top podium step or the summit of the local climb. We will help assess where you are today, where you want to go, and identify the steps needed to get there.

​

In this module, you will enable consistent progress by creating a habit of identifying monthly and weekly goals, with weekly rewards for achieving those goals.

​

**GET THE WORKBOOK**

If you haven't yet, download the [Mental Training Workbook](https://drive.google.com/file/d/11VIC1ZmuIwDpmv9xdeUrZ6NJ_nZraqPv/view?usp=sharing).

It's a fillable PDF, but you can print it if you prefer to work from a hard copy.

​

​

​

​

​

​

prospects.name: 04. Getting Positive
prospects.description:
Thoughts matter. To accomplish big goals you need the ability to maintain a positive mindset, regardless of what life gives you. Here's an overview of the power of maintaining a positive mindset. We’ll introduce specific techniques that will help you identify negative thoughts, see obstacles as opportunities, and take a more positive path forward.

​

**GET THE WORKBOOK**

If you haven't yet, download the [Mental Training Workbook](https://drive.google.com/file/d/11VIC1ZmuIwDpmv9xdeUrZ6NJ_nZraqPv/view?usp=sharing).

It's a fillable PDF, but you can print it if you prefer to work from a hard copy.

prospects.name: 05. Remembering Why
prospects.description:
Focus is essential to high performance. Without it, you can become distracted, give in to self-doubt, and struggle to motivate yourself. Strengthen your willpower through a deep understanding of your key motivators and then develop a system to remind you of them on a daily basis.

​

**GET THE WORKBOOK**

If you haven't yet, download the [Mental Training Workbook](https://drive.google.com/file/d/11VIC1ZmuIwDpmv9xdeUrZ6NJ_nZraqPv/view?usp=sharing).

prospects.description:
Here you will complete a full Progressive Muscle Relaxation session. It’s part guided meditation and part focus exercise. You should listen to this module at least once per week to get in tune with your body, release tension, and maximize recovery.

​

**GET THE WORKBOOK**

If you haven't yet, download the [Mental Training Workbook](https://drive.google.com/file/d/11VIC1ZmuIwDpmv9xdeUrZ6NJ_nZraqPv/view?usp=sharing).

prospects.name: 07. Positive Self-Talk
prospects.description:
Improve your confidence and performance through three types of positive self-talk: Motivational, Instructional, and Reward. Here, we’ll look at the subtle and not-so-subtle effects that words have on our attitude and performance. You’ll listen more closely to the way you talk to yourself so you can improve that internal dialogue and become your own biggest fan.

​

prospects.description:
Develop an understanding of why focused concentration is so important to your performance. We will delve into what it means to be in “The Zone," look at the psychology and the physiology of peak performance, and what it takes to get there.

**GET THE WORKBOOK**

If you haven't yet, download the [Mental Training Workbook](https://drive.google.com/file/d/11VIC1ZmuIwDpmv9xdeUrZ6NJ_nZraqPv/view?usp=sharing).

prospects.name: 10. First Month Review & Improve
prospects.description:
You’ll look back at each of your weekly goals, as well as your overall goal for the month, to see how you did. This is your chance to give yourself a pat on the back, celebrate your successes, and identify how you’re going to do even better.

​

After looking to see what the past month can teach you, you’re going to turn your attention towards what lies ahead, setting new monthly and weekly goals.

​

**GET THE WORKBOOK**

If you haven't yet, download the [Mental Training Workbook](https://drive.google.com/file/d/11VIC1ZmuIwDpmv9xdeUrZ6NJ_nZraqPv/view?usp=sharing).

It's a fillable PDF, but you can print it if you prefer to work from a hard copy.

prospects.name: 11. The Successful Training Habit
prospects.description:
Let's zoom in on how you actually train, day in and day out. Great training sessions don’t just happen. You have to make a conscious effort, get everything together, then actually do the work. Successful athletes don’t leave their training to chance—they have a specific routine they go through **EVERY. SINGLE. TIME.** The more deliberate you are with your thoughts and actions before, during, and after your workouts, the better your training habit becomes and the greater your progress.

​

**GET THE WORKBOOK**

If you haven't yet, download the [Mental Training Workbook](https://drive.google.com/file/d/11VIC1ZmuIwDpmv9xdeUrZ6NJ_nZraqPv/view?usp=sharing).

prospects.name: 12. Workout Review
prospects.description:
We’re going to take the techniques you've learned during the “Monthly Review and Improve“ module, and apply them to your training sessions. This module should be completed immediately after finishing a workout. Have your workbook with you so after the cool-down you can start the workout review exercise immediately.

prospects.description:

prospects.description:

prospects.description:
This process mirrors what you did in week five. If you feel like you’re making gains, it’s likely you’ve been getting the work in. If you’re not progressing—if you feel run down—look to see if there are any patterns.

prospects.name: 17. Overcoming Obstacles
prospects.description:
Rainbows? Puppy dogs? Not always. Sometimes things go wrong and this session will get you moving again. As a visualization exercise, this module is meant to be listened to whenever you feel stuck—whether that’s due to an obstacle you can’t see a way around, an injury, a loss of motivation, or any other reason which makes you doubt yourself. Even if you don’t have an obstacle right now, it’s a good idea to go through the module so you know what it’s about and when to use it. It will help you re-focus, reset, and reestablish your confidence in who you are and where you’re headed.

​

prospects.description:
Improve your confidence and performance through three types of positive self-talk: Motivational, Instructional, and Reward. Here, we’ll look at the subtle and not-so-subtle effects that words have on our attitude and performance. You’ll listen more closely to the way you talk to yourself so you can improve that internal dialogue and become your own biggest fan.

What - exactly - are you trying to accomplish? When you're ready to answer that question, this module will help you gain clarity on who you are as an athlete and identify your major goal—your Personal Big Mountain.
